taskHome.taskDescription: Issue management helps teams collaborate efficiently, track progress, and deliver on time.
taskHome.workItem1: Plan project activities and scheduling through iterations;
taskHome.workItem2: Assign tasks clearly with responsible parties for efficient collaboration;
taskHome.workItem3: Monitor project health and progress trends in real-time.

emptyStates.noCreatedTasks: You haven't added any tasks yet,
emptyStates.noConfirmingTasks: You have no tasks to confirm

messages.confirmDelete: Are you sure to delete task 「{name}」?

backlog.title: Backlog
backlog.aboutBacklogDesc: Backlog is a task list containing Product Backlog and Sprint Backlog. Used to manage team work tasks, covering all current and future work items.
backlog.productBacklogDesc: Product requirements list maintained by Product Manager, containing feature requests, bug fixes, and technical improvements, sorted by priority.
backlog.sprintBacklogDesc: Current sprint work items selected from Product Backlog, defining specific tasks the team will complete in this sprint.

taskTypeDescriptions.requirement: User expectations or requirements for business, functionality, etc., with broad descriptions.
taskTypeDescriptions.story: Specific goals or expectations that users want to achieve, usually described in concise, understandable language, such as: As a <role>, I want <goal> so that <benefit>.
taskTypeDescriptions.apiTest: API functionality, performance, and stability testing tasks
taskTypeDescriptions.scenarioTest: Scenario functionality, performance, and stability testing tasks

messages.deadlineMustBeFuture: Deadline must be a future time

aiGenerateTask.title: Auto Create Backlog
aiGenerateTask.aiKeywordsPlaceholder: Describe your requirements to the AI agent, such as: Generate 10 main Wiki system product Backlogs.

tooltips.deadlineDate: Deadline must be greater than current time

placeholders.workloadRange: Minimum 0.1, maximum 1000, up to 2 decimal places

descriptions.assignee: Person responsible for actually executing assigned work tasks.
descriptions.confirmer: Person responsible for verifying and validating work results, will automatically enter confirmation process when assigned.
descriptions.tester: Person responsible for testing and validating product functionality or service quality.
descriptions.evalWorkload: Estimated value of work task volume, comprehensive difficulty, and complexity.
descriptions.actualWorkload: Actual value of work task volume, comprehensive difficulty, and complexity.
descriptions.tags: "Task tags" can help you organize tasks with common points, such as "project name, sprint version, business identifier", etc.

assocTaskTab.title: Tasks
assocTaskTab.tips: Record other tasks associated with the current task to help the team understand the dependencies between tasks.

assocRequirementTab.title: Requirements
assocRequirementTab.tips: Trace problems to the original requirements to help understand the background and scope of the problem.

assocStory.title: Stories
assocStory.tips: Trace user-centric functional requirements to help understand the background and scope of the problem.

assocBugTab.title: Bugs
assocBugTab.tips: Trace problems to the original requirements to help understand the background and scope of the problem.

assocCaseTab.title: Functional Cases
assocCaseTab.tips: Record other tasks associated with the current task to help the team understand the dependencies between tasks.

assocApiTestTab.title: API Tests
assocApiTestTab.tips: Establish a relationship with the corresponding API test task to facilitate the tracking of API test progress and ensure normal operation of the interface.

assocScenarioTestTab.title: Scenario Tests
assocScenarioTestTab.tips: Establish a relationship with the corresponding scenario test task to facilitate the understanding of the effectiveness of functions in real scenarios and ensure the completeness of the solution.

taskSprint.title: Sprint
taskSprint.aboutSprintDesc: Sprints break down projects into fixed time cycles (usually 1-4 weeks) of work units. Each sprint has clear goals, deliverables, and acceptance criteria, ensuring teams continuously deliver value. Teams can better plan work, track progress, identify risks, and conduct retrospectives and improvements at the end of each sprint.

benefits.organizeWorkDesc: Break down complex projects into manageable iterations with clear goals and deliverables
benefits.enhanceCollaborationDesc: Facilitate communication and collaboration among team members to improve work efficiency
benefits.improveTransparencyDesc: Increase visibility into project progress and issues for better management and decision-making
benefits.improveFlexibilityDesc: Quickly respond to changes and adjust priorities and plans
benefits.improveQualityDesc: Ensure product quality through continuous integration and testing
benefits.enhanceSatisfactionDesc: Increase customer and team satisfaction through rapid delivery and feedback

placeholder.inputAcceptanceCriteria: Define specific conditions and standards for software product delivery
placeholder.inputOtherInformation: Additional notes such as sprint strategy, risk assessment and management

tips.ownerTip: The owner is responsible for overall sprint planning and execution, including task assignment, progress tracking, and risk management
tips.taskPrefixTip: Task prefix helps identify tasks belonging to this sprint for easier management and tracking
tips.workloadAssessmentTip: Workload assessment method estimates task effort to help the team plan sprints better
tips.attachmentTip: Supports uploading relevant documents, designs, requirement specifications, etc. for team reference

anthModal.title: Sprint Permission
anthModal.onTips: After enabling "Permission Control", you need to manually authorize service permissions for the sprint to have corresponding operation permissions. The default setting is "Permission Control". Note: If the authorization object does not have parent project permissions, it will automatically grant view permissions.
anthModal.offTips: After enabling "No Permission Control", all users will be allowed to view and operate the current sprint publicly. Users with view permissions also need to have parent project permissions for the current sprint.

taskMeeting.title: Meetings
taskMeeting.aboutMeetingDesc: Meetings play a key role in agile frameworks, helping teams continuously improve, increase work efficiency, and ensure projects can flexibly respond to changes through regular communication, feedback, and reflection.
taskMeeting.notAddedYet: You haven't added any meetings yet, immediately
taskMeeting.deleteSuccess: Meeting deleted successfully, you can view the deleted meeting in the recycle bin

placeholder.inputLocation: Record meeting location or online meeting link

messages.meetingTypeTip: Specify meeting type for identification and management.

meetingTypes.productGroomingDesc: Clarify product vision and near-term goals. Refine and prioritize the backlog to ensure feasibility. Participants: Product Owner, Dev Team, Scrum Master, stakeholders.
meetingTypes.sprintPlanningDesc: Define sprint scope and workload. PO presents backlog; team discusses, estimates, and selects deliverables. Participants: Scrum Master, Product Owner, Dev Team.
meetingTypes.dailyStandupDesc: Sync progress, blockers, and plans in minutes. Keep sprint status visible and collaboration tight.
meetingTypes.sprintReviewDesc: Show deliverables, gather feedback, and update backlog. Align next steps. Participants: Scrum team and stakeholders.
meetingTypes.sprintRetrospectiveDesc: Reflect on process, identify issues and improvements, commit actions for the next sprint. Participants: Scrum team.
meetingTypes.otherDesc: Other agile meetings such as technical/requirement reviews, release planning, impediment removal, team building, etc.

taskAnalysis.title: Analysis
taskAnalysis.aboutAnalysisDesc: Provides real-time task data analysis, supports data-driven decision making, ensures information transparency, enhances team collaboration and issue tracking, and improves project management efficiency. AngusTester includes built-in analysis templates such as burndown charts, backlog tasks, and risk assessments to help quickly view dashboards and key performance indicators (KPIs). Users can also customize analysis dashboards based on business needs.
taskAnalysis.notCreatedYet: Not created yet, click to create

placeholder.inputAnalysisDesc: Enter analysis description, such as analysis purpose, background, etc., maximum 200 characters

messages.confirmUpdateSnapshot: Confirm update snapshot content for analysis 「{name}」?

dataSource.snapshot: Save data snapshot, display snapshot data each time

confirm.deleteAll: Are you sure you want to delete all items?
